skill.name: diffdock
skill.description: Diffusion-based molecular docking. Predict protein-ligand binding poses from PDB/SMILES, confidence scores, virtual screening, for structure-based drug design. Not for affinity prediction.
skill.summary: Diffusion-based molecular docking. Predict protein-ligand binding poses from PDB/SMILES, confidence ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration was found. Scripts focus on local validation and result parsing only.

content.value_statement: You need reliable docking poses without guessing parameters. This skill guides setup, batch inputs, and confidence based result review.
actual_capabilities: Check DiffDock environment and dependency status with a setup script
Create a batch CSV template for protein and ligand inputs
Validate batch CSV rows, file paths, and SMILES strings
Analyze DiffDock outputs and rank confidence scores
Export result summaries to CSV for downstream review
limitations: Does not run DiffDock inference itself
Does not predict binding affinity or kinetics
Requires external DiffDock installation and data files
GPU is recommended for practical runtimes

use_cases.title: Pose prediction setup
use_cases.description: Prepare inputs and review confidence rankings for a target protein and small molecule series.

use_cases.title: Batch screening workflow
use_cases.description: Generate and validate CSV inputs for large screening campaigns with consistent formatting.

use_cases.title: Result triage summary
use_cases.description: Export ranked confidence reports to prioritize compounds for visual inspection.

prompt_templates.title: Check environment
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the setup check and summarize any missing packages and CUDA status.

prompt_templates.title: Create batch CSV
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a starter input file
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a batch CSV template with three examples and explain each column.

prompt_templates.title: Validate inputs
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to validate a CSV
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my batch_input.csv and list any row level problems with fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze results
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze results in results/batch and export a top 10 confidence summary.

output_examples.input: Validate my batch CSV and summarize issues
output: Missing protein_path or protein_sequence in 3 rows
Two ligand file paths do not exist

best_practices: Use GPU and precomputed embeddings for large batches
Review multiple top poses, not only rank 1
Combine confidence scores with visual inspection
anti_patterns: Running large batches without validating CSV inputs
Using protein sequences without ESM installed

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Any system that can run Python and DiffDock dependencies. GPU support improves speed.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not estimate binding affinity and is not designed for large protein protein docking.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the CSV preparation and result analysis scripts in your automation.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The scripts read local files you provide and do not send data to external services.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Fix missing columns, empty identifiers, or invalid paths, then rerun validation.

faq.question: How does it compare to classical docking?
faq.answer: It predicts poses with diffusion models and provides confidence, but classical tools still help score affinity.
